name: Tis the Season Art Exhibition
description: Created by students from local schools, the works in this exhibition speaks to the seasonal changes from autumn to winter, like snowfalls and long periods of darkness, and the cultural traditions they help shape.

name: "His Name is Ray" Documentary Screening in Honour of National Housing Day
description:
In honour of National Housing Day, join us for a screening of "His Name Is Ray," a moving documentary chronicling Raymond Martin's struggle with homelessness and addiction on Toronto's streets as he attempts to reclaim his life and reconnect with his past as a sailor. 

After, join a thought-provoking panel moderated by Nam Kiwanuka, award-winning journalist and TVO host, with panelists Nicole Luongo (Canadian Drug Policy Coalition), Dr. Andrew Boozary (University Health Network), and Michael Aucoin (F.R.E.S.H. Recovery).

name: Susan Henley and Patti Loach: Out of the Question
description:
Described as "witty, nostalgic, and thoroughly entertaining", Questions is a two-woman show that revolves around songs that ask and answer.

Susan Henley and Patti Loach share stories and songs that range from poignant to preposterous, drawn from the realms of cabaret, pop, film, opera, country and jazz. Audiences are given insight into the context of the songs and the women who perform them and will come away from the evening knowing they have just witnessed a "tightly woven musical journey as enchanting as it was accomplished". Brenda Heatherington, artistic director.

organizer.name: Jazz In Toronto's All That Cabaret

name: In Solidarity with Land Defenders in the Amazon
description:
Indigenous land defender Laura Vicu√±a Pereira Manso will speak about the struggle of the Karipuna people to defend their land in the Amazon.

The evening includes an exclusive Canadian screening of "The Illusion of Abundance", a film about three brave women fighting land exploitation in Latin America.

name: Luke Vasjar
description:
Playing original loop style bass music in styles of funk, jazz, psychedelic, lounge. 

These are the main genres found in his music, however one can hear influences from virtually all styles of music. 

Luke has been playing constantly around Toronto neighbourhoods as well as internationally.  He has released over a dozen albums and is always working on taking the music to new places full of colour, dynamics and surprises. 

The story like compositions feature the instrument in a rhythmic and melodic soundscape where one can tune in and listen more closely for the details within. The groovy vibes help create an atmosphere for a social crowd or for a more focused listen. Whatever the type of night it may be, the aim is to create great times for all that get to be there.

name: A THING OF BEAUTY: The Early Years Of Toronto's Old City Hall
description:
Join us at the Hot Docs Ted Rogers Cinema to explore the dramatic history and breathtaking architecture of this magnificent landmark. Built in 1899, Old City Hall survived the 1904 Great Fire and a near-demolition for the Eaton Centre.

This film, directed by Michael Kainer, is a passionate call for preservation, offering an exclusive, stunning look inside at the murals, stained glass and courtrooms. Hear the story from planners, judges, and staff. Discover why this currently shuttered building is the heart of Toronto and join the crucial discussion about its future.

This screening is presented in partnership with Toronto History Museums (THM) and the filmmaker, Michael Kainer.
